title: Saved Logins
content:
Hi, I am having trouble with multiple logins being saved on site login pages. Where I have entered the wrong email, I can find these in passwords and delete them, no problem.

The way logins are saved in other cases is inconsistent. For example, some sites are saving the same login with multiple dates - why? These are not available in saved passwords to delete. This doesn't happen on every site and needs to be disabled. Other sites are saving logins for other unrelated pages. I have one page that gives me a dropdown for login to three other sites. These sites are not linked or associated with each other in any way and again, can't be found in password to delete.

The only advice I have found is to use the down arrow to select the login and press delete but this does not work anywhere. I have deleted history, disabled fill usernames and passwords automatically. History, cookies and data is set to clear every time Firefox is closed.

Driving me nuts...........................

title: When I go to Google Hangout video chat settings and choose "multi-output device" it crashes my firefox. Twice in a row. And firefox never crashes on me.
content: When I go to Google Hangout video chat settings and choose "multi-output device" it crashes my firefox. Twice in a row. And firefox never crashes on me. Context: I installed something called Black Hole onto my Mac computer in hopes of getting the clean audio from Adobe Premiere to play through Google video chat. I started following this tutorial https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ogkquCAMHhc but deviated a little bit. Right now my Sound Settings under Apple's "System Systems" are set to "multi-output device" but when I go to google video chat settings to choose the same multi output device it crashes firefox. And when I open firefox back up and go to google video chat settings, it defaults to the audio settings being set to "Blackhole 16ch". I havent tested the video chat yet with "Blackhole 16ch" as the audio setting but i'd like to be able to test that as well as "multi-output device" without it crashing firefox. No I dont want to try on Google Chrome. I want to do this on firefox because that's where all my bookmarks are.

title: firefox browser working improperly with many websites
content:
For years, Firefox has been my default browser, but I am at wits end with Firefox not working with SO MANY websites.

Usually, it just hangs up and doesn't connect, or it gets stuck on one page and will not advance to the next. At this point, I'm ready to demote Firefox and my Chrome my default browser. In fact, I'm sending this message from the website opened in Chrome because it would not open in Firefox.

I'm using a Mac mini running MacOS Sequoia 15.5, but this has been happing with all of the last versions of MacOS.

As I said, it's been years, but I no longer have the patience to deal with Firefox. I wish Mozilla could fix it, but it doesn't seem likely after all this time.

title: Change in the menu History > Recently Closed Tabs
content: Hi folks Since the beginning of Mozilla, in Firefox the item History > Recently Closed Tabs contained the tabs that had belonged to the foreground window: easy to use, straightforward, intuitive. For some reasons now it's all the tabs of all the windows in chronological order. It became practically unusable. Who the heck thought this was a smart move: turning a very practical feature into a useless one? Is there a turn-around? Maybe it's like the Window menu that used to be in chronological order and turned into an alphabetical order: a bureaucratic decision completely unaware of the users preferences. Nick
creator: daum.nicolas

title: Firefox এ TikTok খুলতে গেলে “Potential Security Issue” আসে
content:
আমি Windows 10 ব্যবহার করি। Firefox দিয়ে www.tiktok.com খুলতে গেলে নিচের এরর মেসেজটি আসে:

"Did Not Connect: Potential Security Issue"

এখানে বলা হয় Firefox নিরাপদ সংযোগ করতে পারছে না এবং সাইটটি HSTS ব্যবহার করে। অন্য সব ওয়েবসাইট ঠিকঠাক খুলছে, শুধু TikTok এ সমস্যা হচ্ছে।

আমার কম্পিউটারের সময় ও তারিখ ঠিক আছে। Firefox এর সর্বশেষ ভার্সন ব্যবহার করছি।

এই সমস্যার সমাধান কীভাবে করব দয়া করে জানাবেন?

ধন্যবাদ।

title: Firefox doesn't launch with previously used windows and tabs if you closed the window while having a private window open
content:
Version 140.0.4 (64-bit)

As the title states, if you have a private window open and you close your main (non-private) window and attempt to relaunch Firefox (mine is at the taskbar) you will then encounter a window with none of the previously opened tabs and simply a single fresh tab. This is despite having the setting to continue browsing where I left off in the settings ("Open previous windows and tabs") enabled. Luckily the lost window can be recovered by going to History -> Recently closed windows -> "___tab names____"

title: Navigating the Finnish Digital Landscape: My Success with Listtodata.com's Finland Telegram Data
content:
Hei! I'm Matti, and I'm a community manager for a tech startup that relies heavily on secure and direct messaging platforms for user support and updates, especially in European markets. In Finland, Telegram has a significant user base among tech-savvy individuals and specific professional communities. My biggest challenge was efficiently acquiring segmented Finland Telegram Data that allowed us to reach early adopters, developers, or professionals in the IT sector. Generic contact lists simply didn't offer the crucial interest-based insights or active Telegram user data.

About ten months ago, I discovered List to data and their specialized Finland Telegram Data. Their focus on providing insights into active, tech-oriented Telegram users was exactly what we needed to refine our outreach. The database provided was incredibly accurate and allowed us to segment users based on their expressed interests in technology, software development, or participation in specific industry groups within Finland.

This precision meant our announcements for new software features, beta testing opportunities, or exclusive tech webinars, delivered directly through Telegram, resonated much more effectively. We've seen a dramatic increase in user engagement, higher participation rates in our beta programs, and improved overall community satisfaction. Has provided us with an invaluable tool to truly connect with the modern Finnish tech community, streamlining our outreach and driving significant growth for our startup.
creator: TâniaCardoso

title: Profile folder keeps growing larger, how to trim it's size (specific usecase)
content:
Hey,

so, for many years I use firefox with hundreds of tabs, to keep that loading smoothly, I have the Profile folder on a RAM disk, which size is limited. Originally I started with 512MB which seemed plenty, but got bloated eventually, so I increased it to 700MB, then 800MB thinking it should be fine, cause "my personal data" isn't that much.

In the beginning i had to manually clear my own Website Data every couple months, deleting everything older than a year.

Currently I have to delete my personal Data every 10 days and only keep the last 2-3 months, to not run out of space... I also started to not visit heavy Websites with firefox, but with another browser that doesn't run of a Ramdisk, but despite all my efforts I need some other solution.

It feels like some files just keep growing over time without getting rid of old data, and storing new technical files, that i don't want in my profile folder... At this point, getting some extra 50-100MB that doesn't come from deleting my current data would be great... A way, to cleanup any unused data... I tried everything I could find, but I'm kinda stuck. Keeping all my Profile settings, customisations and still used personal Data is really important to me.
